Articles.Content:
Since I haven't seen anyone post it here yet...

What do you think? I think it shows promise, also nice to see a movie about interstellar travel as well.
I like the idea and the premise, but the relationship thing could've been left out to be fair.
Looks interessting! To bad the chance to win a Zero-G flight is limited to USA&Canada...
Looks like it shows some promise. They have a good premise, good actors... Let's hope the writing and direction are good as well.

11 hours ago, SpaceXray said:

What do you think?

Jennifer Lawrence got more gracile.

P.S.
A screw-shaped ship incarnates best steampunk concepts of a fiction ship.  It She flies thru da space screwing into aether.

Star in the videoscreen (I hope, it's not a window) moves under such speed and angle, that probably they are performing heliobraking maneuver.

Director likes Jen's feet. Artist likes ovals. Both of them suffer from claustrophobia.

Mechnical joysticks suck on such cybership  - neurointerface is in order. The same about cup made of clay. The same about mechanical head+neck of the floor-bot, it should have less mechanics.

Refrigerators are placed very... extensively. Why not keep them as cells in a morgue. Director and artist suffer from claustrophobia.

Very many solid walls. All of them could be screens with Earth landscapes or at least something more 3d.
I would not be surprised if the crew will suffer from claustrophobia, too. And begin poking heads out of the airlocks to have a breathe...
...Update. At 1:19 they do.

Spacesuits are even better than usually. Not only helmets have lamps inside, but a huge lamp on the chest. Just to be sure the spacemen can't watch where they step.

To ensure that android will not rebel as in Alien, they cut his legs off and impaled him with a stake. Forethoughtfully, +1.

As all free floor is already occupied by diner chairs and sleeping boxes, the submarine is hanged (on ropes?) beneath the ceiling. Wise.

Edited September 22, 2016 by kerbiloid

18 hours ago, kerbiloid said:

 

You work for CinemaFails or something?
Thanks! Now I want watch it!

On 9/22/2016 at 8:29 PM, KerbMav said:

You work for CinemaFails or something?

CinemaSins you mean?

I watch them, they're pretty good, but sometimes, the 'sins' don't make sense.
Hollywood really ran out of actors.

20 hours ago, lajoswinkler said:

Hollywood really ran out of actors.

Agreed.  There are a lot of celebrities, but very few of what I call actors (and actresses; accepted as a non-sexist word by those who nominate, are nominated for and receive awards for their performances).
